recipe.title: Tomato, Chickpea and Coconut Curry

inspiration.text: 30 minute Chickpea and Tomato Coconut Curry - Nyssa's Kitchen

recipe.ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil 1 medium onion, diced small 4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced 1 tsp salt 1 tbsp curry powder 400g chopped tomatoes 800g canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed 400mL coconut milk 2 cups of broth of choice Juice of half a lime (1 tbsp) Handful of roasted cashews
Fresh lime wedges Thinly sliced red onion Roasted cashews

method.step: Heat the oil over medium heat in a large pot. Add the onion garlic and teaspoon of salt. Saute for about 5- minutes, stirring occasionally, until translucent and soft
Next, add the curry powder and stir almost constantly for about 30 seconds or so, until the spices are fragrant and start to stick to the bottom of the pan.
Add the diced tomatoes and broth
Scrape up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Bring to the boil and then reduce to a simmer.
Cover and cook for about 10 minutes, until tomatoes are soft.
Add chickpeas and coconut milk and bring back up to a simmer. Simmer for another 5 minutes or so to marry the flavours
Season with salt and pepper, and 1 tbsp lime juice (juice of half a lime)
Serve topped with sliced red onion, roasted cashews and lime wedges
